alert.note: Alert for Cocke (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 5:35AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Cocke, Greene, Hamblen, Hawkins and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morristown, Greeneville, Tusculum, White Pine, Baneberry, Parrottsville, Russellville, Mosheim, Bulls Gap, Baileyton, Mohawk, Caney Branch, Romeo, Cedar Creek, Lowland, Bybee, Camp Creek, Chucky and Davy Crockett Birthplace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
